biography.value:
The dragon Galazeth Prismari embodies the flow of magic from inspiration into artistic expression, whether through physical form or another sensory medium. His magic draws on primal energy—such as flame, lightning, and the tides—and weaves them into spectacles both beautiful and deadly.

Galazeth founded Prismari College to ensure that the study of magic wouldn’t ever be relegated to pure practicality. His teachings emphasize that magic’s beauty must contribute to unfolding culture and personal emotional growth. Galazeth views dynamic expression and precise perfection as necessarily competing forces, both within individuals and the world at large.

description.value:
Galazeth makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d10 + @mod type=piercing average=true]] damage plus [[/damage 1d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Galazeth exhales a blast of flames and ice in a 90-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a [[/save dex 22 format=long]], gaining no benefit from cover (other than total cover) and taking [[/damage 7d10 type=fire average=true]] damage and [[/damage 7d10 type=cold average=true]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Galazeth casts one of the following spells, requiring no &Reference[material]{material} components and using &Reference[cha]{Charisma} as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 23):

1/day each: control water, gust of wind, wall of stone

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage 1d6 + @mod type=slashing average=true]] damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}.

The [[lookup @name]] attacks with its [[lookup @item.name]].

Galazeth can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature’s turn. Galazeth regains spent legendary actions at the start of his turn.

Claw. Galazeth makes one Claw attack.

&Reference[lightning]{Lightning} Flash (Costs 2 Actions). Galazeth moves up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When he passes within 15 feet of a creature during this move, that creature must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage. A creature can take this damage no more than once during the move.

Flowing Creation (Costs 3 Actions). Galazeth magically summons 1d4 art &Reference[elemental]{elemental} mascot;art &Reference[elemental]{elemental} mascots in unoccupied spaces he can see within 60 feet of himself. The art elementals obey his commands and take their turns immediately after his. Any creature, other than an art &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, takes 5 (1d10) &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[fire]{fire}, or &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage (Galazeth’s choice) if it ends its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these elementals. When one of these elementals drops to 0 hit points, Galazeth can fly up to 20 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. These elementals disappear after 10 minutes, when Galazeth dies, or when he uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Galazeth moves up to half his flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks. When he passes within 15 feet of a creature during this move, that creature must succeed on a [[/save dex 22 format=long]] or take [[/damage 2d10 type=lightning average=true]] damage. A creature can take this damage no more than once during the move.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]] and a save is required.

Galazeth magically summons 1d4 art &Reference[elemental]{elemental} mascot;art &Reference[elemental]{elemental} mascots in unoccupied spaces he can see within 60 feet of himself. The art elementals obey his commands and take their turns immediately after his. Any creature, other than an art &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, takes 5 (1d10) &Reference[cold]{cold}, &Reference[fire]{fire}, or &Reference[lightning]{lightning} damage (Galazeth’s choice) if it ends its turn within 5 feet of one or more of these elementals. When one of these elementals drops to 0 hit points, Galazeth can fly up to 20 feet without provoking opportunity attacks. These elementals disappear after 10 minutes, when Galazeth dies, or when he uses this action again.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Legendary Resistance (3/Day). If Galazeth fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

The [[lookup @name]] uses [[lookup @item.name]].

Until the spell ends, you control any freestanding water inside an area you choose that is a &Reference[cube]{cube} up to 100 feet on a side. You can choose from any of the following effects when you cast this spell. As an action on your turn, you can repeat the same effect or choose a different one.

Flood. You cause the water level of all standing water in the area to rise by as much as 20 feet. If the area includes a shore, the flooding water spills over onto dry land.

If you choose an area in a large body of water, you instead create a 20-foot tall wave that travels from one side of the area to the other and then crashes down. Any Huge or smaller vehicles in the wave's path are carried with it to the other side. Any Huge or smaller vehicles struck by the wave have a 25 percent chance of capsizing.

The water level remains elevated until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. If this effect produced a wave, the wave repeats on the start of your next turn while the flood effect lasts.

Part Water. You cause water in the area to move apart and create a trench. The trench extends across the spell's area, and the separated water forms a wall to either side. The trench remains until the spell ends or you choose a different effect. The water then slowly fills in the trench over the course of the next round until the normal water level is restored.

Redirect Flow. You cause flowing water in the area to move in a direction you choose, even if the water has to flow over obstacles, up walls, or in other unlikely directions. The water in the area moves as you direct it, but once it moves beyond the spell's area, it resumes its flow based on the terrain conditions. The water continues to move in the direction you chose until the spell ends or you choose a different effect.

Whirlpool. This effect requires a body of water at least 50 feet square and 25 feet deep. You cause a whirlpool to form in the center of the area. The whirlpool forms a vortex that is 5 feet wide at the base, up to 50 feet wide at the top, and 25 feet tall. Any creature or object in the water and within 25 feet of the vortex is pulled 10 feet toward it. A creature can swim away from the vortex by making a &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check against your spell save DC.

When a creature enters the vortex for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and is caught in the vortex until the spell ends. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage, and isn't caught in the vortex. A creature caught in the vortex can use its action to try to swim away from the vortex as described above, but has disadvantage on the &Reference[str]{Strength} (&Reference[ath]{Athletics}) check to do so.

The first time each turn that an object enters the vortex, the object takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage; this damage occurs each round it remains in the vortex.

A &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the &Reference[line]{line}.

Any creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the &Reference[line]{line} blasts from you.

A nonmagical wall of solid stone springs into existence at a point you choose within range. The wall is 6 inches thick and is composed of ten 10-foot- by-10-foot panels. Each panel must be contiguous with at least one other panel. Alternatively, you can create 10-foot-by-20-foot panels that are only 3 inches thick.

If the wall cuts through a creature's space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side of the wall (your choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall (or the wall and another solid surface), that creature can make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.

The wall can have any shape you desire, though it can't occupy the same space as a creature or object. The wall doesn't need to be vertical or rest on any firm foundation. It must, however, merge with and be solidly supported by existing stone. Thus, you can use this spell to bridge a chasm or create a ramp.

If you create a span greater than 20 feet in length, you must halve the size of each panel to create supports. You can crudely shape the wall to create crenellations, battlements, and so on.

The wall is an object made of stone that can be damaged and thus breached. Each panel has AC 15 and 30 hit points per inch of thickness. Reducing a panel to 0 hit points destroys it and might cause connected panels to collapse at the GM's discretion.

If you maintain your &Reference[concentration]{concentration} on this spell for its whole duration, the wall becomes permanent and can't be dispelled. Otherwise, the wall disappears when the spell ends.
